TopicTitle: What heappened to: Tweakable engine fuel types?

Articles.Content:
In the 0.23 development posts it mentioned Tweakable engine fuel types. I wonder what happened to them. Did the idea get scrapped or did they not have enough time to implement it in 0.23?

Edited January 8, 2014 by Kinglet
You can adjust the levels of fuel and oxidiser in a tank using the right-click context menu in the editor, this is the extent of fuel tweaking at this time

You can adjust the levels of fuel and oxidiser in a tank using the right-click context menu in the editor, this is the extent of fuel tweaking at this time

No, I think you misunderstand. I meant that they mentioned that you can change the type of propellant engines use.

I edited the main post to avoid further confusion.

Mind linking to that?

Stock KSP engines are intended to use basic fuel types, liquid fuel, monopropellent and so on, anything more exotic has been ruled out I think.

Mind linking to that?

Stock KSP engines are intended to use basic fuel types, liquid fuel, monopropellent and so on, anything more exotic has been ruled out I think.

You could change LF engines to use mono propellant.

And I'm searching for a link. It's a pain that the news bar does not show older posts...
Please close this thread, i derped. There probably was no mention of tweakabke engine fuel types.
There was a mention of NTRs no longer using oxidiser, but that's all I know about, And it was related to both tweakables and resources, although dependent only on the first one.
